name: DEFCON 0
description:
DEFCON is a fun-filled game where you get to enjoy the exhilarating feeling you get when you’re about to die.

You are Australia’s last hope against a nuclear attack. Disaster is imminent, but it is your job to stall for time so that the citizens of the main cities can escape.

READ FIRST

  • The game did not crash, you died

—————— How To Play ————————————-

The game is a text-based game, all commands are typed in a text field at the top left.

Prompt 1: Choose a base The city that you base in is entirely up to you, if that city is destroyed, so are you !– Game Over –!

Following Prompts: Missile Incoming When you see a message that says a missile is approaching a city, it is your job to counter it with the “defend” command.

It is noted that you are not going to be able to save everyone, you are only stalling for time. At some point, you are going to have to make a decision on which missiles to let through.

—— < Commands > ——

Write the following without the “” and []

“defend [city]” Type this when a missile is approaching a city, make sure to type in the city that is being targeted.

“status [city]” This lets you know the population of the city, not that useful but may help you decide which cities to let fall.

“spy” This expends a spy to see the next 3 targets for missiles. Note: if it is targeting a city that has already fallen, it will skip it.

—— < Resources > ——

Silos: You have 3 silos located in Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney. They are put on a 45-second cooldown when you use them to defend.

RADAR: You have 3 RADAR units located in Darwin, Perth and Brisbane. They are needed to see when the next missile will hit the next city.

Spies: You have 3 spies, once you have expended all 3, you will not know what cities the next missiles will target.

Capital: Your capital is located in Canberra, if Canberra falls, your silos cooldowns are increased to 60 seconds.

Instructions included in zip file.
